Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class ProfileThin

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.geotess.Profile
gov.sandia.geotess.ProfileThin
public class ProfileThin extends Profile
A Profile defined by a single radius and a single Data object.

  • Field Details

    • gradients

      protected double[][] gradients
      The gradients of the GeoAttributes. Constant with respect to radius. nAttributes x 3.

    • gradientReciprocal

      protected boolean[] gradientReciprocal
      The reciprocal flag for each stored gradient. If true and the gradient for attribute i is defined (gradients[i] != null), then the stored gradient is reciprocal for the defined attribute (e.g. the Reciprocal of SSLOWNESS is the S wave velocity).

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object other)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • getRadius

      public double getRadius​(int node)
      Description copied from class: Profile
      Get the i'th radius value in this profile in km. Radii are in order of increasing radius.

      Behavior when i is out-of-bounds:

      • ProfileEmpty - i == 0 ? radii[0] : radii[1]
      • ProfileThin - always returns radii[0]
      • ProfileConstant - i == 0 ? radii[0] : radii[1]
      • ProfileNPoint - throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if i is out of range
      • ProfileSurface - always return Double.NaN
      Specified by:
      getRadius in class Profile
      Returns:
      the i'th radius value in this profile in km.

    • setRadius

      public void setRadius​(int node, float radius)
      Specified by:
      setRadius in class Profile

    • isNaN

      public boolean isNaN​(int nodeIndex, int attributeIndex)
      Return true if the specified Data value is NaN. For doubles and floats, this means not NaN. For bytes, shorts, ints and longs, always returns false since there is no value that is NaN
      Specified by:
      isNaN in class Profile
      Parameters:

      attributeIndex -
      Returns:

    • getData

      public Data[] getData()
      Description copied from class: Profile
      Retrieve a shallow copy of the array of Data objects associated with this profile. The number of elements depends on ProfileType:
      • EMPTY -- 0
      • THIN -- 1
      • CONSTANT -- 1
      • NPOINT -- N
      • SURFACE -- 1
      • SURFACE_EMPTY -- 0
      Specified by:
      getData in class Profile
      Returns:
      Data[]

    • getData

      public Data getData​(int node)
      Description copied from class: Profile
      Retrieve a reference the i'th Data object.
      • ProfileEmpty - returns null
      • ProfileThin - i is ignored. Always returns Data[0]
      • ProfileConstant - i is ignored. Always returns Data[0]
      • ProfileNPoint - throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if i is out of range
      • ProfileSurface - i is ignored. Always returns Data[0]
      • ProfileSurfaceEmpty - returns null
      Specified by:
      getData in class Profile
      Returns:
      Data

    • getRadii

      public float[] getRadii()
      Description copied from class: Profile
      Get the radii values in km. For ProfileNPoint object, returns a reference to the profiles radii array. The other profile classes return a new float[] that contains the available radius values. ProfileSurface returns new float[0].
      Specified by:
      getRadii in class Profile
      Returns:
      the radii values in km.

      Parameters:

    • setPointIndex

      public void setPointIndex​(int nodeIndex, int pointIndex)
      Set the pointIndex that corresponds to the supplied nodeIndex.

      There is a node index for each Data object in a profile and they are indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects managed by a Profile. There is a pointIndex for every Data object in the entire model, indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects in the model.

      Specified by:
      setPointIndex in class Profile
      Parameters:
      nodeIndex -
      pointIndex -

    • resetPointIndices

      Specified by:

    • getPointIndex

      public int getPointIndex​(int nodeIndex)
      Get the pointIndex that corresponds to the supplied nodeIndex.

      There is a node index for each Data object in a profile and they are indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects managed by a Profile. There is a pointIndex for every Data object in the entire model, indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects in the model.

      Specified by:
      getPointIndex in class Profile
      Parameters:
      nodeIndex -
      Returns:
      poitnIndex

    • computeGradients

      protected void computeGradients​(GeoTessModel model, int attributeIndex, double[] unitVector, int layerId, boolean reciprocal) throws GeoTessException
      Synchronized method to compute the gradient of a thin layer. Does nothing if gradient is already computed.
      Overrides:
      computeGradients in class Profile
      Parameters:
      model - GeoTessModel for which gradients are evaluated.
      attributeIndex - The attribute for which gradients are calculated.
      unitVector -
      layerId -
      reciprocal - A boolean flag, that if true, stores the gradient of the inverse attribute field.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException
